thread.title: Chelsea transfer news: Manchester United and Blues target Tiemoue Bakayoko rejects new Monaco contract | Metro News
thread.title_full: Chelsea transfer news: Manchester United and Blues target Tiemoue Bakayoko rejects new Monaco contract | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Chelsea transfer news: Manchester United and Blues target Tiemoue Bakayoko rejects new Monaco contract | Metro News
text:
Chelsea and Manchester United transfer target Tiemoue Bakayoko rejects new Monaco contract gossip Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 7:07 pm Tiemoue Bakayoko has become an important player for Monaco (Picture: Getty) 
Chelsea and Manchester United have been handed a transfer boost after target Tiemoue Bakayoko reportedly rejected a new Monaco deal. 
Premier League leaders Chelsea were said to have made a serious approach to sign the 22-year-old last week, although Manchester City are also eyeing the £25.5million-rated star. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
Bakayoko, who has made over 50 appearances for Ligue 1 Monaco since signing from Rennes in 2014, is believed to be interested in a move to England. 
And, according to Le Parisien, the midfielder has snubbed the chance to extend his current contact amid speculation over his future. Jose Mourinho and Antonio Conte are both said to be keeping tabs on the midfielder (Picture: Getty) 
Antonio Conte’s Blues are expected to enjoy a productive transfer window in the summer and are keeping tabs on Bakayoko. 
Manchester United are also reportedly expressing interest in the player, however, with a move to the Premier League a real possibility.
